page.title: 01Ballantrae-Strathclyde.
page.content: Village and parish southernmost in Ayrshire,on Clyde coast,with tidal harbour,near River Stinchar.Area- little wooded,mostly pasture/arable, very fertile in Stinchar valley,hilly- highest Knockdolian Hill 265m-flat in Stinchar valley and along coast below a"raised beach"Village has church,bank doctor,primary school,post office, police station,shops,hotels,tearoom, garage,community centre,public library bowling and putting greens and tennis courts.No manufacturing or mining.Most employment depends on agriculture.A former fishing port,it now has few fishermen.Lies on trunk road A77 with heavy traffic to and from ferry ports on Loch Ryan.Climate-mild,wet and very windy. Main vestiges of the past are ruins of Ardstinchar Castle and a wind mill,a Kennedy tomb(1604) and old Stinchar bridge(1770).
